Description: Sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater consisting of part of rim, neck, and shoulder; interior glazed with two broad red bands; between them white dot rosette with red centre; on top of rim, incised palmette and lotus chain with red on petals; exterior: on neck and shoulder, streaky glaze fired reddish brown; dot rosette with red centre.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For similar rim motifs see Payne 1931, 154, fig. 62.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 220)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p.103, no. A157)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.015) (Phase 1)
